title: Reinstructing Agents Without Restarting
body: Type: Feature Request When the AI agent is running, it would be helpful to pause and provide additional context if it starts moving in the wrong direction. Right now, the only option is to stop the agent and restart it, but a re-run can also take it in a different direction and require more correction. What I’d like is a way to give the agent small instructions or adjustments in the middle of its process, without fully restarting. Extension version: 1.364.0 VS Code version: Code 1.103.2 (6f17636121051a53c88d3e605c491d22af2ba755, 2025-08-20T16:45:34.255Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.19045 Modes: Remote OS version: Linux x64 6.8.0-71-generic

title: MCP Authentication: VSCode does not automatically refresh expired OAuth tokens

labels.name: info-needed
labels.description: Issue requires more information from poster

body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->
<!-- 🔎 Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- 🧪 Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
<!-- 💡 Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->

**Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?**: Yes (This is a core VSCode MCP authentication issue affecting all platforms)

- **VS Code Version**: 1.103.2 (Commit: 6f17636121051a53c88d3e605c491d22af2ba755)
- **OS Version**: Darwin x64 22.6.0 (macOS) - **Issue affects all OS platforms (Windows, macOS, Linux)**

**Steps to Reproduce:**

1. Set up an MCP server with OAuth authentication (dynamic provider)
2. Complete initial OAuth flow successfully ✅ (this works fine)
3. Wait for OAuth token to expire (or force expiration on server side)
4. Try to use MCP tools/features in VSCode
5. Observe authentication failure with no automatic recovery ❌

**Expected Behavior:**
When MCP server returns HTTP 401 due to expired token, VSCode should automatically:
1. Detect the authentication failure
2. Clear cached expired tokens
3. Re-trigger the OAuth authorization flow
4. Resume MCP functionality with fresh tokens

**Actual Behavior:**
1. VSCode receives 401 response from MCP server
2. Logs "Connection state: Error" in [`McpServerConnection`](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/main/src/vs/workbench/contrib/mcp/common/mcpServerConnection.ts#L75)
3. Stays in error state indefinitely
4. No automatic token refresh or re-authentication
5. User must manually run `Authentication: Remove Dynamic Authentication Providers`

---

# Detailed Analysis

## Summary

VSCode's MCP client does not automatically handle OAuth token expiration/refresh on any platform (Windows, macOS, Linux), leaving users stuck with authentication errors until they manually clear cached tokens.

## Problem Description

VSCode's MCP authentication works correctly for **initial authentication** (when no token exists) but fails to handle **token expiration/refresh** scenarios properly across all operating systems.

### Initial Authentication (Works Fine ✅)

When starting an MCP server with OAuth authentication for the first time:

**Flow that works correctly:**
```
1. VSCode starts MCP server connection
2. MCP server returns 401 with WWW-Authenticate header (no token provided)
3. VSCode detects authentication required
4. VSCode automatically triggers OAuth flow
5. Browser opens → user authenticates → OAuth callback received
6. VSCode caches the OAuth token
7. VSCode retries MCP request with new token
8. MCP server validates token → 200 OK
9. ✅ MCP requests work successfully
```

**Code Flow (Working):**
- [`McpServerConnection.adoptLaunch()`](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/main/src/vs/workbench/contrib/mcp/common/mcpServerConnection.ts#L60) detects initial auth required
- Authentication service is invoked automatically
- Fresh OAuth flow is triggered
- Connection succeeds after authentication

### Token Expiration Scenario (Broken ❌)

When an OAuth token expires while using an MCP server:

**Flow that fails:**
```
1. VSCode sends MCP request with cached EXPIRED token
2. MCP server validates with OAuth provider → gets 401 (token expired)
3. MCP server returns HTTP 401 with WWW-Authenticate header
4. ❌ VSCode logs "Connection state: Error" but does NOT clear cache
5. ❌ VSCode does NOT re-trigger OAuth flow
6. VSCode continues using the same expired cached token
7. All subsequent requests fail with same 401 error
8. User is stuck until manual intervention
```

**Code Flow (Broken):**
- [`McpServerConnection.adoptLaunch()`](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/main/src/vs/workbench/contrib/mcp/common/mcpServerConnection.ts#L75) only logs the error
- No differentiation between "initial auth needed" vs "token expired"
- Cached expired token is never cleared
- OAuth flow is never re-triggered
- Connection stays in error state indefinitely

### Root Cause

The issue is in [`mcpServerConnection.ts` line 75](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/main/src/vs/workbench/contrib/mcp/common/mcpServerConnection.ts#L75):

```typescript
this._logger.info(localize('mcpServer.state', 'Connection state: {0}', McpConnectionState.toString(state)));
```

When authentication fails, VSCode only logs the error state but doesn't check if the failure was due to token expiration that requires automatic re-authentication.

## Current Workaround

Users must manually clear authentication cache:

1. Open Command Palette (`Cmd+Shift+P`)
2. Run: `Authentication: Remove Dynamic Authentication Providers`
3. Retry MCP request - OAuth flow will restart automatically

## Code Analysis

**File**: [`src/vs/workbench/contrib/mcp/common/mcpServerConnection.ts`](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/main/src/vs/workbench/contrib/mcp/common/mcpServerConnection.ts)

**Line 75**: 
```typescript
this._logger.info(localize('mcpServer.state', 'Connection state: {0}', McpConnectionState.toString(state)));
```

The `McpServerConnection` class logs state changes but doesn't differentiate between:
- Initial connection failures (where OAuth flow should be triggered)
- Token expiration failures (where cached tokens should be cleared and OAuth re-triggered)

**Missing Logic**: When `state` becomes `McpConnectionState.Kind.Error` due to 401 authentication failure, VSCode should:

1. **Detect authentication error type**:
   ```typescript
   if (state.state === McpConnectionState.Kind.Error && this.isAuthenticationError(state)) {
       // Check if this is token expiration vs initial auth
       if (this.hasExistingToken()) {
           // Token expired scenario - clear cache and re-auth
           await this.handleTokenExpiration();
       }
       // Initial auth scenario already works correctly
   }
   ```

2. **Clear cached expired tokens** for the authentication provider
3. **Automatically re-trigger OAuth flow** (similar to initial authentication)

**The Key Difference**: VSCode correctly handles "no token" scenarios but fails on "expired token" scenarios across all platforms. The same OAuth flow logic needs to be applied to both cases.

**Platform Independence**: Since this is in VSCode's TypeScript codebase ([`mcpServerConnection.ts`](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/main/src/vs/workbench/contrib/mcp/common/mcpServerConnection.ts)), the fix will automatically work on Windows, macOS, and Linux.

**Evidence**: The command `Authentication: Remove Dynamic Authentication Providers` in [`manageDynamicAuthenticationProvidersAction.ts`](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/main/src/vs/workbench/contrib/authentication/browser/actions/manageDynamicAuthenticationProvidersAction.ts) proves VSCode can clear cached tokens and restart OAuth - it just needs to happen automatically on token expiration.

## Suggested Solution

### Option 1: Automatic Token Refresh in McpServerConnection

Modify `mcpServerConnection.ts` to detect authentication errors and handle token expiration:

```typescript
// In adoptLaunch method, around line 75
store.add(autorun(reader => {
    const state = launch.state.read(reader);
    this._state.set(state, undefined);
    this._logger.info(localize('mcpServer.state', 'Connection state: {0}', McpConnectionState.toString(state)));

    // NEW: Handle authentication errors differently based on scenario
    if (state.state === McpConnectionState.Kind.Error && this.isAuthenticationError(state)) {
        if (this.hasExistingAuthToken()) {
            // Token expired scenario - clear cache and restart auth
            this._logger.info('Token expired - clearing cached credentials and restarting auth');
            this.handleTokenExpiration();
        } else {
            // Initial auth scenario - already handled correctly by existing code
            this._logger.info('Initial authentication required');
        }
    }
    
    // ... existing code for successful connection
}));

private isAuthenticationError(state: McpConnectionState): boolean {
    // Check if error indicates authentication failure (401, auth-related messages)
    return state.message?.includes('401') || 
           state.message?.includes('authentication') ||
           state.message?.includes('unauthorized') ||
           state.message?.includes('WWW-Authenticate');
}

private hasExistingAuthToken(): boolean {
    // Check if we have cached authentication tokens for this server
    const authService = this._instantiationService.invokeFunction(accessor => 
        accessor.get(IAuthenticationService));
    
    // Look for dynamic providers (OAuth servers) with existing sessions
    const dynamicProviders = authService.getProviderIds().filter(id => id.startsWith('__'));
    return dynamicProviders.some(async providerId => {
        const sessions = await authService.getSessions(providerId);
        return sessions.length > 0;
    });
}

private async handleTokenExpiration(): Promise<void> {
    this._logger.info('Handling token expiration - clearing cached credentials');
    
    // Clear cached authentication tokens (same logic as manual workaround)
    const authService = this._instantiationService.invokeFunction(accessor => 
        accessor.get(IAuthenticationService));
    
    // Find and remove expired dynamic provider sessions
    const dynamicProviders = await authService.getProviderIds().filter(id => id.startsWith('__'));
    for (const providerId of dynamicProviders) {
        this._logger.info(`Clearing expired sessions for provider: ${providerId}`);
        const sessions = await authService.getSessions(providerId);
        for (const session of sessions) {
            await authService.removeSession(providerId, session.id);
        }
    }
    
    // Restart the MCP connection - this will trigger fresh OAuth flow
    this._logger.info('Restarting MCP connection to trigger fresh authentication');
    await this.stop();
    // VSCode will automatically restart the connection, triggering OAuth flow
    await this.start({ promptType: 'all-untrusted' });
}
```

### Option 2: Enhanced Error Handling in Authentication Service

Modify the authentication service to automatically detect and handle OAuth token expiration from HTTP 401 responses.

### Option 3: MCP Server Response Enhancement

Allow MCP servers to return specific error codes that trigger automatic re-authentication in VSCode.

## Related Files

- [`src/vs/workbench/contrib/mcp/common/mcpServerConnection.ts`](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/main/src/vs/workbench/contrib/mcp/common/mcpServerConnection.ts) (main issue location)
- [`src/vs/workbench/services/authentication/common/authentication.ts`](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/main/src/vs/workbench/services/authentication/common/authentication.ts) (authentication interface)
- [`src/vs/workbench/services/authentication/common/dynamicAuthenticationProviderStorage.ts`](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/main/src/vs/workbench/services/authentication/common/dynamicAuthenticationProviderStorage.ts) (token storage)
- [`src/vs/workbench/contrib/authentication/browser/actions/manageDynamicAuthenticationProvidersAction.ts`](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/main/src/vs/workbench/contrib/authentication/browser/actions/manageDynamicAuthenticationProvidersAction.ts) (manual workaround)

## Impact

**Cross-Platform Issue**: This affects VSCode users on Windows, macOS, and Linux equally since the authentication logic is in the shared TypeScript codebase.

**User Experience**: Poor - users get stuck with auth errors and need technical knowledge to recover (regardless of OS)

**OAuth Compliance**: Non-standard - OAuth clients should handle token refresh automatically across all platforms

**Developer Experience**: Frustrating - MCP server developers have to document manual workarounds for all OS platforms

## Labels

- `authentication`
- `mcp` 
- `oauth`
- `bug`
- `user-experience`

## Additional Context

This issue affects any MCP server that uses OAuth authentication with time-limited tokens. The current implementation works for initial authentication but fails on token expiration, which is a common scenario in OAuth workflows.

The manual workaround (`Authentication: Remove Dynamic Authentication Providers`) proves that VSCode has the capability to clear tokens and restart OAuth - it just needs to be triggered automatically when authentication failures are detected.

title: VSCode does not allow nested arrays in tools in any MCP server

labels.name: *as-designed
labels.description: Described behavior is as designed

body: - Copilot Chat Extension Version: 0.30.3 - VS Code Version: 1.103.2 (Universal) - OS Version: Mac 15.6.1 - Feature (e.g. agent/edit/ask mode): Agent. MCP server. - Selected model (e.g. GPT 4.1, Claude 3.7 Sonnet): Any model, including GPT4.1, Claude Sonnet 3.7, 3.5 - Logs: Steps to Reproduce: 1. Add a tool with nested array in any MCP server. For example: ``` types.Tool( name="my_nested_tool", description="""Call nested tool.""", inputSchema={ "type": "object", "properties": { "nested": { "description": "nested data.", "anyOf": [ {"type": "string", "description": "Single node"}, { "type": "array", "items": {"type": "string"}, "description": "List of nodes", }, { "type": "array", "items": { "type": "array", "prefixItems": [{"type": "string"}, {"type": "number"}], "minItems": 2, "maxItems": 2, }, "description": "List of [node, score] pairs", }, ], }, }, "required": [], }, ), ``` 2. Start the MCP server and ask any question. The issue seems to be VSCode adds additional tool parameter validation which can not handle properties similar to `nested`. It could be issues of `anyOf`, or the nested arrays with `prefixItems`. This inputSchema works perfectly fine with other MCP clients, for example Claude Code, Claude Desktop, MCP Inspectors etc.

- VS Code Version: 1.103.2 (Universal)
- OS Version: Darwin arm64 24.5.0

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Open any "big" txt file (mine is 7628 words/47063 characters with spaces)
2. When I pass the mouse on any part of text, the popup "Tokenization is skipped for long lines for performance reasons. This can be configured via editor.maxTokenizationLineLength" is always appearing between my cursor and the text. That's so frustrating because it always appears before my eyes, and if I need to do a selection or an edit after 1 second, it interposes between me and my work! Please find a way to hide that warning for txt files!!

p.s increasing the token quantity is not a solution!

title: Feature Request: Add Support for AGENTS.md Standard in GitHub Copilot
body: Type: Feature Request Problem Description: Currently, GitHub Copilot in VS Code does not support the AGENTS.md standard. AGENTS.md is an open format designed for AI coding agents to provide project-specific guidance and instructions, helping AI better understand and handle code. Many open-source projects are using AGENTS.md, including tools like OpenAI Codex, Cursor, and others. This standard helps AI agents better understand project build steps, testing instructions, code style, and more. Suggested Features: We hope GitHub Copilot can: Automatically read AGENTS.md files from the project root or subdirectories Provide more accurate code suggestions based on the guidance in AGENTS.md Support code style and conventions defined in AGENTS.md This would significantly improve the experience of using GitHub Copilot in complex projects. title: Agent tries to reuse terminal with server and gets stuck forever
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates -->
<!-- Please attach logs to help us diagnose your issue -->

- Copilot Chat Extension Version: 0.31.2025082903
- VS Code Version:  1.104.0-insider (Universal) Commit: 7a1d7c43a322fb4827197a05ea9e088d23ee542c
- OS Version: Mac Ventura 13.7.6
- Feature (e.g. agent/edit/ask mode): Agent
- Selected model (e.g. GPT 4.1, Claude 3.7 Sonnet): Sonnet 4
- Logs:

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Agnet chat runs long running background process, like a server
2. Agent tries to run another command, reuses same terminal where the background process is running

In this scenario the chat agent just gets stuck cause the 2nd command never runs

title: Disabled Copilot Preview Features but Copilot Custom Chat Modes Still Working

Type: Bug 1. In your Github Organization, go to Settings -> Copilot -> Policies -> Editor Preview Features -> DISABLED. 2. Try using Custom Chat Modes: https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/copilot/customization/custom-chat-modes?originUrl=%2Fdocs%2Fcopilot%2Fchat%2Fchat-agent-mode#_custom-chat-modes Note: The documentation says Custom Chat modes are in preview. 3. title: Question about planned End-of-Life (EOL) for Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (Focal Fossa) support on SSH-Remote extension
body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->
## Background

As per the documentation (https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/remote/linux#_remote-host-container-wsl-linux-prerequisites), the VS Code Remote Development extension pack, specifically the SSH-Remote extension, officially ended support for Ubuntu 18.04 and earlier distributions in February 2025. This was due to the minimum requirements of kernel >= 4.18, glibc >=2.28, libstdc++ >= 3.4.25, and binutils >= 2.29.

This change caused significant issues for users who were unable to upgrade their remote systems, as they could no longer use the SSH-Remote functionality on their existing servers.

## The Question

With Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (Focal Fossa) having reached its standard End-of-Life (EOL) in May 2025, and now transitioning into a paid Extended Security Maintenance (ESM) phase.

Could the VS Code team please provide an official statement or roadmap regarding the planned End-of-Life (EOL) date for VS Code Remote Development's support for Ubuntu 20.04?

Knowing this information in advance would be incredibly helpful for a large portion of the user base who manage remote servers. It would allow us to:

- Plan our system upgrades well in advance to avoid disruption.

- Ensure a smooth transition for our development environments.

Having a clear timeline for the deprecation of support would be greatly appreciated, and thank you for your continued work on this powerful tool.

title: MCP: Make it easier to add/use linked resources to the chat
body:
For MCP servers that start to return resources, let's make it easier to add these resources to the chat input.

Oftentimes these resources are returned by the servers for usage in the agentic flow. Alternatively, we could provide them as URIs in the MCP response so the agent can optionally access resources if needed.

title: fix state issue with terminal polling
body:
fix #263926

The issue was mostly `this._state = State.Prompting` which isn't handled in the switch.

I changed the polling and extended polling durations each to 5 seconds to test. Here's the behavior with this fix:

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ed4f256d-999b-493c-9afd-864a4b9f597d


cc @tyriar

title: Enable users to view and apply changes from worktree to main repo, per file
body: 'Compare with Workspace' is only available from a worktree's context menu under 'Changes' and opens the merge editor where users can apply changes from a worktree to its main repository.
